item.title: Make Wayland Scaling Less Painful
item.description: Wayland is awesome. It supports my 4K 60Hz monitor out-of-the-box without any Xorg configuration or custom EDID file hackery. Even gaming on Wayland more or less works. There’s only one problem or I would have ditched Xorg forever. Everything on the 4K monitor is really really tiny! You might say, why not just apply some scaling? After all, KDE Plasma has great fraction scaling support and just worksâ„¢ on Xorg. The problem is that Wayland apps scale perfectly but XWayland apps… not so much.

item.title: Plasma 5.22 is a Disappointment
item.description: Originally posted on my old blog The KDE Plasma update train has cycled back again to another major update, so I snatched Plasma 5.22 from the very scary testing repository, took it for a spin, and it’s… disappointing. What’s the big new feature this time? Adaptive transparency, apparently. Adaptive what? Yeah, if you were expecting something big, another huge leap forward, this update was anything but that. If you think panel transparency is a big deal, think again.

item.title: How to Break a Rolling Release
item.description: Originally posted on my old blog It’s the day! Plasma 5.21 is out! First, let me flex my neofetch to answer all your burning questions about my OS: Now, time for the update. The big one. The closest thing to a point update in a rolling release. And… Lots of updates, but Plasma 5.21 is not one of them. Digging a bit deeper, it looks like it’s still in testing. Looks like we need to enable it first.
